newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures higher on short-covering.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures higher on short-covering.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures ended firmer across the board on Friday, lifted by sporadic short-covering in lacklustre activity, traders said.
Prices ranged from 1.0 yen to 2.1 yen per kg higher. Benchmark January stood 1.0 yen up at 138.1 yen.
Amid a dearth of fresh incentives, trade was mainly dominated by position-adjustment ahead of the weekend and the spot expiry on Monday.
"Most private investors retreated to sidelines amid uncertainty over market direction after the spot expiry next Monday," said an analyst at a commodity brokerage.
